title: Magnetic flux - constant velocity loop thru field

content.question: A rectangular loop of wire is moved into, through, and out of a region with a uniform magnetic field directed into the page, as shown in the figure. At Position <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the loop has not yet entered the magnetic field. At Position <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, half of the loop has entered the field. At Position <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, the loop is entirely within the field. At Position <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> only half of the loop remains in the field. Which of the following correctly compares the magnetic flux <math alttext="phi sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="phi sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="phi sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="phi sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mstyle></math> through the loop when the loop is at positions <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, and <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="phi sub 4 is greater than phi sub 3, which is greater than phi sub 2, which is greater than phi sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub 3 is greater than phi sub 2, which is greater than phi sub 1, which is greater than phi sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub 3 is greater than open parenthesis, phi sub 2 equals phi sub 4, close parenthesis, which is greater than open parenthesis, phi sub 1 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, phi sub 1 equals phi sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than open parenthesis, phi sub 2 equals phi sub 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="phi sub 3 is greater than open parenthesis, phi sub 2 equals phi sub 4, close parenthesis, which is greater than open parenthesis, phi sub 1 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
